text: Normand “Norm” LaPointe (born August 13, 1955) is a Canadian former professional ice hockey goaltender. ==Playing career== As a youth he played in the 1965 Quebec International Pee-Wee Hockey Tournament with a minor ice hockey team from Saint-Vincent-de-Paul, Quebec, and the 1967 tournament with a team from Pointe-Claire. He was selected by the Vancouver Canucks in the 3rd round (46th overall) of the 1975 NHL Amateur Draft, and was also drafted by the Cincinnati Stingers in the 4th round (46th overall) of the 1975 WHA Amateur Draft. LaPointe played three seasons in the World Hockey Association with the Cincinnati Stingers. In January 1979, the Fort Wayne Komets traded LaPointe to the Toledo Goaldiggers in exchange for defenceman Peter Brown. Toledo Blade - January 15, 1979 – Page 23 – Brown Goes to Komets for Netminder ==Awards and honours== Award Year CCM QMJHL Player of Year 1974–75 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1955 births Category:American Hockey League players Category:Canadian ice hockey goaltenders Category:Ice hockey people from Quebec Category:Laval National players Category:Living people Category:Trois-Rivières Draveurs players Category:Trois-Rivières Ducs players
title: Norm LaPointe
